Reviews.Title: “So Good !”
Reviews.Author: journalist92
Reviews.Content: A well-located ( near the Termini Station with good access for city- transport to the most famous historical points in the Eternal City), with clean rooms, Wi-Fi (24 h), TV and surrounded by dozens of markets, hotel "Katty" gives you feeling that you are really in the Rome. In the heart of Italian capital. You don't need a very expensive taxi or bus from Termini; you can find it very easy, just take a map and address ( with address you even don't need the map) and you will be there after 15-20 minutes of walking. The building is in the residential part surrounded by numerous hotels, residential buildings, restaurants and two embassies: Brazilian and Turkish, so I recommend it as a very safe location . The hotel is on the 4th and 5th floor of the resident building so it gives you unique chance to see how does live ordinary Rome family. I really had great single-bed room (107) with small balcony filled with colorful flowers. The balcony views on balcony of Italian happy family with a small kid, and I could hear how they sing to the kid every day. It was so beautiful. So romantic. I didn't see them but I could feel the harmony of their home. I liked to widely open balcony's door in the morning listening their voices. It wasn't noise. Not at all. It was a song of love. Somewhere in my mind they associate me a scenes with Sofia Loren in old Italian movie, but this time I couldn't see Sofia. Nevertheless, it stays the spirit of romantic Rome. Small cafe nearby the hotel is place for the breakfast. You can take cappuccino or coffee with croissant or domestic cake. Enough to start new day. Small and romantic cafe in the street where that still exists some places from 1970's and 1980's such as a cinema for adult There is a small mini-bar and it is allowed guest to bring the own drinks and some foods. Hotel isn't expensive. Not at all ! I paid 245 Euros for period of 5 nights with breakfast + city tax + discount ( if you pay cash). Knowing the horrible hotel price in the Rome, this is really affordable option. I am sure you can find cheaper, but be carefully. Cheap hotel in Rome means mutual WC and bathroom. I talked with people that took a room in such hotel and they had to wait in line to go in WC . Horrible. I had private bathroom. New and clean . It is very important, especially when you arrived in your room, tired after long walking around the Rome. Staff is great. It is great safety in hotel. I left my lap-top in my room while I was touring the Rome and everything was O.K. On the leaving of the room they stored my bags, for free, giving me a paper as an evidence about it. I will back agan to this hotel. I have already recommended it to my international colleagues. It is so good that I reccomend to all of you who will read this.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location near Termini and relatively quiet”
Reviews.Author: Foreignforays
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as a replacement for one that pulled out on us the day before we were leaving for Rome (water works problems apparently which could be code for we have overbooked, had a better offer, or are going on holiday ourselves as it happened in two locations and it seems hard to believe that coincidence) and we were thus very relieved that although we did not have the time to recommence our research, it was a good choice. Located next door to the German Embassy up a quieter side street and only 10 minutes gentle stroll from Termini, it was surprisingly quiet. Located on the 5th floor, it was a large room for Rome and the bathroom was clean and relatively new. There was lift access in a small but adequate lift if your luggage is not huge. At check in we were given tokens to provide each morning to a cafe about 5 minutes walk away in the neighbourhood to have coffee and a pastry for breakfast which was a nice change from eating in the room and a simple start to the day. There is a restaurant two doors down which we went to on one night when we couldn't be bothered going further afield but I found it a bit overpriced for what was served and the meal ended up costing more than the night's accommodation and that was without wine.

Reviews.Title: “Just meet expectation”
Reviews.Author: Lau M
Reviews.Content: Mixed good and bad: Maybe it was too full. We were required to change room during 2 nights' sleep. It caused us a bit trouble to repack our stuff. Bathrooms are clean though I saw a small thing like cockcroach. Breakfast is so so - the boss in the cafe associated were easy going though there is a typical Italian breakfast included - coffee and pastry. Customer service is so so - one of them are friendly and one is not. Maybe due to the fact that the room is large, we felt cold at night even there is a heater! There is a lift, and only this little hotel only occupied 2 floors of a building. Good: Discount was given due to our payment in cash. % is larger than expected. Location is really good. We felt really safe because we can see soldiers stationed around for ambassies around. People said Rome was a dangerous place. Here, I don't think so. I got nearby supermarket and walked around at night was nice. The rooms are relatively spacious. A really large double beds (combining 2 single beds)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Spacious and Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Dini S
Reviews.Content: We're a family of four (my son was 12 and my daughter was 5). My husband chose the hotel and we loved it! It was clean and very close to Termini Station. Our kids were happy to have spacious room and it was including yummy breakfast (Croissant and lots of chocolate). The location was very convenient to many tourist places. If we visited Rome again, we will surely choose Katty Hotel. The reason we gave 4 was just because the front desk wasn't available 24 hours. The elevator was very very small and old but it worked well!!

Reviews.Title: “near station”
Reviews.Author: jacquesFremantle
Reviews.Content: single bed near station helpfull people . nice little cafe for breakfast .tiny lift but full of character.i enjoyed it JACK FROM FREMANTLE WESTERN AUSTRALIA.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lizd82
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean and comfortable. The staff were very nice and helpful. A great position - very close to the train station. Supermarket around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: cmancilla
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 5 nights with my son and it was super clean. They are willing to help with directions and all. Breakfast is included. It's a walking distance from the Termini Station. I alked early in the morning and late at night and it was pretty safe neighborhood. I recommend this hotel. The downsize is that the internet connection is a little bit slow if you need to use it. The 5th floor was better than the 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value.Budget accommodation, impolite staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jert_Jerterson
Reviews.Content: Arrived here last Sunday (29th May for 3 nights.) Sharing a quad room with 3 others. Pro's:- Good location. Close to the Metro. Good value in a city where average accommodation is expensive. Breakfast voucher for the nearby cafe is a nice touch, albeit not very substantial. Working air-con. Fridge. Cons:- Cheap, budget hotel. Poor selection of toiletries. Tired, old rooms in need of decoration. Poor shower. Impolite staff that let themselves into the room even when they knew you were in there. Old bedding.

Reviews.Title: “great stay - cheap, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: mandajg
Reviews.Content: great value for money, stayed in a quad room. Room wasn't cramped, had a closet to hang clothes and a great heater! We were greeted by a young spunky italian, he pointed out to us where breakfast was (cafe around the corner, served coffee and pastry) and some places where we should visit in rome. There was also an older lady who didn't speak english but smiles and some Buongiorno and ciao got us by! The room was clean and beds comfortable. The bathroom was slightly small, but you can put up with it for the price we paid for the room. Would defiantly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good hotel near station”
Reviews.Author: Ramon-Rachel
Reviews.Content: Well we were not expecting many frills from this one but basic hotel features. The room is spacious and also the toilet is big enough too. Rooms are kept very clean and also each morning towels are replaced and toiletries are replenished. Breakfast is not provided by hotel owners but by 3rd parties a few roads away - consisting of some pastries, a coffee and some juice. Location is great since its very close to termini station - just 10mins walk and you're there. I recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant !!”
Reviews.Author: loisbobcat
Reviews.Content: We booked a quad room at the Katty in Rome as there were 3 of us travelling together and also because Rome is so expensive, we wanted to try and keep the costs down and have a relatively cheap-ish long weekend! I have admit to being slightly apprehensive as we arrived in Rome as to what the Katty Hotel would be like not for any other reason than it being more of budget accommodation and I wasnt sure what to expect. However, I had absolutely nothing to worry about or be concerned about whatsoever. The hotel was fantastic, very clean, we were very well looked after by the owner and her family (I think its family run?), we had fresh towels every day, the room was cleaned and tidied every day and was absolutely spotless, it was fully air-conditioned (on remote control), the room we stayed in was absolutely massive - I have stayed in many 5 star hotels that have never had that amount of room and space in one hotel room!! and we had keys so we could come and go as we pleased. Breakfast was included and we were given vouchers to pop along to a small cafe a few minutes walk away for croissant and coffee (options of regular coffee or latte, cappucino etc) and the breakfast was very nice with lovely fresh, sweet croissants stuffed with jam :-) We didnt stay out particularly late, but on the one night we did, it wasnt a problem at all. The Katty Hotel is ideally located near the Termini - about a 10 minute stroll around the corner, and across a square. Its a safe area as a lot of the embassies appear to be around that area so lots of armed guard around outside of the buildings which only added to our feeling already very safe. There are two supermarkets within a two minute walking distance and the Hotel is close to Linea A and B - A going into the Termini and B stopping literally at the corner of the road of where the Hotel Katty is. The hotel also has wi-fi available which was handy when we wanted to check-in for our return flight. I would definitely recommend staying here, and if I do manage to get back to visit Rome again, this is most definitely where I wil be staying ! Thank you Katty Hotel for a wonderful stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “Clean quiet room, rock hard mattress.”
Reviews.Author: u35828
Reviews.Content: Pros about this hotel; it's close to the Metro Caestro Pretorio B line stop, as well as a 20 minute walk from the Roma Termini. The rooms are clean, quiet, and have a contemporary decor. It boasts amenities like a mini-fridge, a remote-controlled air conditioner, and a flat screen TV. It's also near decent restaurants along Via Palestro and Via Castelfidardo. Our unit is on the 6th floor (the 5th floor in European parlance), but serviced by a tiny elevator. Now the cons: the mattress was rock hard, and not very comfortable. Opting for the breakfast service is of dubious value, as the nearby bar provides a minimal breakfast, consisting of one fruit-filled croissant, and your choice of tea or coffee. In summary, travelers on a budget who want more than what a hostel offers, might want to put this one on their short list. Those wanting a better night's sleep might want to splurge for a nicer room elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine place, clean, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: New-World-Journeys
Reviews.Content: Senior woman traveled with one friend. We stayed one night and needed to be near the train terminal. Hotel Katty was very clean, had hot water, comfortable beds and was very inexpensive by European standards. Euro 33 each, in high season The woman at the front desk was friendly and helpful. It's on the fourth floor, so you have to take the small, open elevator or walk up.

Reviews.Title: “No, no no....”
Reviews.Author: jwayAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June 2009 for three nights. Easy to find and quite close to the train station. The lift was great as the hotel is on the fourth floor. The owner was reasonably friendly, but spoke little English which was fine as the only word she needed to know was no. As in No internet, No breakfast, No washing clothes in the room. No internet was annoying but there are Internet cafes close by. No breakfast was also annoying but there are cafes close by that do great coffee and crossaint. But the sign stating a 10 euro charge is you wash or cook in the room was extra annoying as we were travelling on a budget and lacked the time to find a laundry and wash. The rooms were fine- clean and a reasonably size. The bathroom was compact. The location was a fair walk from most of the city's attractions. Overall we thought it was expensive for the facilities offered even by Rome's standards. I think we could of got better value at one of the many other hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean city hotel in a save neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: LexiBarcelona
Reviews.Content: Probably the savest neighbourhood there is! Located right between the Turkish and German embassy, streets guarded by fully armoured army soldiers. The hotel is simple but convenient and clean. This down-to-earth family run establishment offers a good functioning AC, a fridge, and a TV with intl stations. The house's daughter speaks good English and is glad to give recommendations. There's no breakfast but you have an internationally run breakfast café (Yellow café) right around the corner where you can get everything from fried beans with bacon to a fitness muesli and fresh fruit for a reasonable price. The location is 10 minutes walking to Termini station and Piazza della Repubblica from where all major buslines depart. During the week, the taxiride from Hotel Katty to al major sights (Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Forum Romanum, etc) is within the 6 Euros range, on weekend this is slightly higher and only if you don't forget to advise the driver to turn on the taximeter ;-) We stayed with 4 persons in 2 rooms and had a good time. Our recommendation as a basis to explore beautiful Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Bad deal”
Reviews.Author: psva8673
Reviews.Content: We were moved to this hotel from Hotel Cressy that we actually booked. Location-wise it is ok, not in the historic centre, but 15min walk from Termini station from where you can get anywhere. A warning on arrival should have been a big sign saying in English "Pay in Advance". Even though we did not even see the room, they wanted us to pay for the full amount of 5 nights. I refused and paid only 3 nights - which was 3 nights too many. She also refused to account for the fact I paid a 10% deposit already and charged us the full amount!!! The AC did not work without the remote control that was only available to borrow from a reception - which was closed at night. So we had to sleep in overheated sauna for two nights when we came too late to borrow it! There was also no breakfast even though we booked bed&breakfastt. Besides, the bathroom was tiny and with stains on the toilet. We moved next-door to Hotel Sally for the last two nights and for the same price we got a nice spacious room with clean and large bathroom, breakfast and working AC! This hotel is simply a terrible value for money!

HotelInfo.Name: Katty Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 35 Via Palestro, 00185 Rome, Italy
